TEI.2.document_title: James Nelson to Stephen F. Austin, 11-06-1824

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 934

div1.p: Dear Sir. Having been disappointed in Receiving the Money that was due me in this Count[r]y. I have been compeld again to Commence work at my old trade of Enjineer in order to raise money to discharge the debts I owe in your Count[r]y— I have now a situation on board the steam boat Natchitoches— and as soon as I can raise sufficient quantity of money shall forward it to you in order to settle my debts— In the mean time I must beg you to see that my property etc is not molested-—as I shall certainly send money—and be out myself early in the spring
